result.execSummary:
The defendant Erica D Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus the $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge

10-09-2015 - The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $567

--to undergo a Psychological Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent (assessment within 60 days)
--to complete a Certified Batterers Intervention programming and any programming recommended by the counselor
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--No Contact with Calvin Lentz, except for childcare exchanges as allowed by Injunction (Jefferson Co. Case 15CV96)
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--Abide by Injunction Order and Orders of Jefferson Co. Family Case

The Court grants Ms. Williams the opportunity to request expungement upon successful completion of Probation. 

Arresting Agency: Jefferson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:

records.addlTxt:
[MA]Case called at 9:22am 
Defendant Erica D Williams in court, in custody with Attorney John A. Chavez.   Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court verifies review of sentencing transcript.

Sentencing recommendation given by ADA Shock
Sentencing argument given by Attorney Chavez

ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Statement made by Ms. Williams
The Court addresses Ms. Williams

On Count #1: The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 135  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for treatment; to commence FORTHWITH
--81 days credit for time already served given

The Court converts all costs to civil judgment. 
recess: 9:40am
Transcript of August 31, 2015 Plea and Sentencing
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 19, 2018 at 09:15 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 6, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $567

It is hereby ordered that: The Defendant is liable for court appointed attorney fees.  Attorney fees shall be assessed and paid as a condition of Probation.  Attorney fee trust payment will be applied to and Probation and Parole will be notified of remaining balance.  The Judgment of Conviction will amended to reflect said order.
Petition for payment of attorney fees
with criminal case settlement and elements

Case called at 3:21pm [mo]
Defendant Erica D Williams in court with Attorney David Robert Westrick.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed.
Upon inquiry from the Court during its colloquy, Ms. Williams indicates that she does not believe that there is an ample amount of factual information to allow a Jury to find her guilty on charges.
recess: 3:25--reconvene:3:28pm [to allow Atty. Westrick to speak with Ms. Williams]

Atty. Westrick indicates that Ms. Williams has some discrepancy with the facts, but not all. And that the facts that Ms. Williams agrees to are enough to find a factual basis
The Court questions Ms. Williams as to the factual basis and finds that there is a substantial amount of factual information
ADA Hall orally motions to amend Count #1 to Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to 940.19(1) and 968.075, a Class A Misdemeanor
--No objection from Atty. Westrick
--The Court Grants the State's Motion to Amend Count #1

plea of "No Contest" entered on Amended Count #1; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Joint Motion of the Parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Williams

On Amended Count #1,  the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
---to undergo a Psychological Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent (assessment within 60 days)
--to complete a Certified Batterers Intervention programming and any programming recommended by the counselor
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--No Contact with Calvin Lentz, except for childcare exchanges as allowed by Injunction (Jefferson Co. Case 15CV96)
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
 plus the $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--Abide by Injunction Order and Orders of Jefferson Co. Family Case

The Court grants Ms. Williams the opportunity to request expungement upon successful completion of Probation. 
Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 4:09pm

Case called at 9:54am [mo]
Defendant Erica D Williams in court with Attorney David Robert Westrick.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Westrick reviews case history; including Demand for Discovery that has not been received from the State.
DA Happ indicates that the Discovery is most likely completed
Atty. Westrick requests a PTC and STC date.
No objection from DA Happ
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 9:57am

NEXT: (1)PreTrial Conference: August 12, 2015 at 9:20am (2) Status Conference: August 25, 2015 at 9:30am

Case called at 10:39am [mo]
Defendant Erica D Williams in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeares for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court is presented with a form indicating that Ms. Williams is not eligible for SPD representation and a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.
The Court reviews Petition for Court Appointed Counsel with Ms. Williams.
The Court finds that Ms. Williams is indigent and grants her Petition for Court Appointed Counsel.
The Court appoints. Atty. David Westrick to Ms. Williams case.
The Court orders Ms. Williams to pay reimbursement for court appointed attorney fees at the rate of $30 per month, beginning July 2, 2015 and on the 2nd of every month thereafter until paid in full. No alternate set at this time. 
The Court adds a condition to Ms. Williams bond to contact Atty. Westrick's office today either by telephone or personally.
recess: 10:47

NEXT: Status Conference---July 7, 2015 at 10:00am
